overview.ovdesc:
This application is used to define the Standard settlement instruction (SSI) for a particular customer and the same is used to default settlement account fields such as
Drawdown account, Principal
liquidation
Account & Interest Liquidation Account, in applications such as LD, MM, etc.
The SSIs defined have the highest priority for defaulting hence
while defaulting, the system will check first the CUSTOMER.SSI application for
a valid record for the CUSTOMER, CURRENCY and SYS.CODE
and it is mapped to the relevant settlement accounts.
If there is no record in CUSTOMER.SSI for the above combination,
then the system uses the branch standard instructions (as per
settings for the relevant SYS.CODE in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER ).
For example :
Create the following record in CUSTOMER.SSI application for customer no. 50041 (Microsoft) :
CUSTOMER.......... 50041
MICROSOFT
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1. 1 CURRENCY....... USD
US Dollar
2. 1. 1 SYS.CODE.... ALL
ALL APPLICATIONS
3. 1. 1 ACCOUNT..... 19526
SSI TEST USD
1. 2 CURRENCY....... GBP
Pound Sterling
2. 2. 1 SYS.CODE.... ALL
ALL APPLICATIONS
3. 2. 1 ACCOUNT..... 27677
SSI TEST GBP
Also, give the following definition in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER application leaving the DEFAULT.ORDER field as blank.
29. 1 SYS.CODE....... ALL
ALL APPLICATIONS
31. 1 DEF.OVERRIDE... YES
32. 1 USE.FIRST.ACCT. YES
In the LD application the Drawdown account, Principal Liquidation account, Interest liquidation account gets defaulted as shown below for that Customer as per CUSTOMER.SSI application definition.
CONTRACT.NO....... LD/03022/00063
1 CUSTOMER.ID....... 50041
MICROSOFT
2 CURRENCY.......... USD
US Dollar
4. 1 AMOUNT......... 1,000,000.00
12 DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT.. 19526
SSI TEST USD
67 PRIN.LIQ.ACCT..... 19526
SSI TEST USD
72 INT.LIQ.ACCT...... 19526
SSI TEST USD

desc.p: Identifies the system code for which SSI is being defined, i.e. (MM for Money Market, LD for loans & deposits).
Must be a valid record in AC.SYS.CODES

t.desc:
This field can be input with a
valid T24 Account. An override is generated when the customer of this account is not same as the ID-Customer.
Validation Rules:
Mandatory Input field.
Standard numeric Account Number or 3-10 character Account Mnemonic (uppercase alpha or numeric) - type MNE.
The entry of an Account number will be verified against the Account File.
However Internal Accounts not allowed.

desc.p: dentifies the currency for which the SSI is being defined.
Mandatory Input field. Must be a valid currency in the CURRENCY table.
3 type SSS (uppercase alpha) character or 1-3 numeric character Currency code.

Id to this application is a valid Customer No in T24. This is the customer for whom the SSI is being defined and it is defaulted when contracts inputted with this Customer in application such as LD,MM etc.
1-10 numeric character Customer Code or 3-10 type MNE (uppercase alpha or numeric or '.') character Customer Mnemonic.
Input allowed only when CUSTOMER.SSI field in ACCOUNT.PARAMETER application is set to "YES" Otherwise not allowed.
